definition: emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated

sentences.english: They asked these questions very sincerely, never talked about anything metaphysically.
sentences.chinese: 向得极其虔诚，就是不谈玄虚。

sentences.english: In the opinion of some lofty experts they never quite cohered again.
sentences.chinese: 在某些玄虚的专家看来，他们没有再完全融洽统一过。

sentences.english: It turns away from the lofty height of the spirit.
sentences.chinese: 它反对玄虚的精神高度。

sentences.english: No educated guesses' about what to do or chart reading.
sentences.chinese: 没有故弄玄虚的猜测和图表统计分析。

sentences.english: It will be my pleasure to share with you some of this double-talk so typical of our times.
sentences.chinese: 我很乐意摘录几则典型的故弄玄虚的评论，与君共享。

sentences.english: Science won't let you juggle a bit.
sentences.chinese: 科学不容许你一点玄虚。

sentences.english: However, the audience will feel that the story is too hypocritical, director mystify .
sentences.chinese: 不过，也会有观众觉得故事太矫情，导演故弄玄虚。

sentences.english: On some level this definition may seem like quite a lot of scientific mumbo-jumbo.
sentences.chinese: 在某种程度上，这一定义可能显得有点故弄玄虚。

sentences.english: Passed on wide pinion through the lofty air.
sentences.chinese: 如何以广展的翅翼飞过玄虚的高空。

sentences.english: I want to be deliberately mystifying in here neither, he does not have but courage.
sentences.chinese: 我也不想在这里故弄玄虚，可是他没有勇气。

definition: deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
profound theory (in Daoism and Buddhism)/mysterious principles
mystery within a mystery/the mysteries of the Dao according to Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]
apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
profound theory/philosophical theory of Wei and Jin 玄學|玄学 sect
great emptiness/the void/heaven/the skies/universe/cosmos/original essence of the cosmos
hard to tell if it's real or sham
dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group
